column4: hi, I am running Ubuntu 8.04 64 bit with 4Gb Ram installed. Now somehoe I only have 800mb free but there is no reason for this :(
did you run the command I said?
can you read the 'histo' in front of my posts?
I've asked you a question twice, so I was making sure you weren't addressing the channel with one of your responses
ok, yes - but I don't know what the outpur tells me
then pastebin it and show us
you have over 2600mb free after taking into account buffers/cache
linux tries to be smart about using your memory.  If it can use it it will.  The idea being that it is doing you no good if you aren't using it.  If another app needs the memory, it will free it up
ok - that makes sense. so how do I uninstall the system monitor?
forget it - it was a joke
I am really missing my Directory Opus though .... nautilus is like Duplo ...
which features do you miss?  (never used it)
just the complete feel of it. dual windows with tabs, etc etc etc
try gnome-commander maybe.  nautilus is getting tabs next release though
I am still trying to get used to Ubuntu (have used various Linux servers over the years) - not really that refined though
